title: Implement mark as ordered
description: After approval, mark order as placed with vendor. Record timestamp.
close_reason: Mark as Ordered button implemented on order detail page for mentors/admins when order is approved. Updates status to 'ordered' with orderedAt timestamp.

title: Set up Turso database for production
description: Create Turso database, configure connection strings, set up migrations workflow.

title: Fix: Vendor detail page exposes non-global vendors by ID
description: In vendors.tsx:209-217, /vendors/:vendorId fetches any vendor by ID without checking isGlobal. Team-private vendors could be exposed if their ID is guessed. Add isGlobal check or team membership verification.

title: Fix: Missing CSRF protection on state-changing HTMX endpoints
description: HTMX POST/DELETE endpoints (role updates, member removal, order actions) don't verify CSRF tokens. Better-Auth provides CSRF but HTMX requests bypass it. Add hx-headers with CSRF token or use Better-Auth's built-in CSRF verification.

title: Add example unit tests
description: Write example unit tests for schema validation, utility functions, and middleware.

title: Create Turso account and database
description:
1. Go to https://turso.tech and sign up (GitHub login works)
2. Create a new database named 'buildseason-prod'
3. Copy the database URL (libsql://buildseason-prod-xxx.turso.io)
4. Create an auth token: turso db tokens create buildseason-prod
5. Save both values securely for later

title: Add vendor management for admins
description: Admin-only: add custom vendors, edit lead times. Most teams just use seeded vendors.

title: Add unit tests for test fixture factories
Build team member management UI

close_reason: Added /teams/:teamId/members page with member list showing avatars, names, emails, and roles. Admins can change roles via dropdown (HTMX) and remove members. Includes role descriptions and guards against self-modification.

title: Remove email/password auth, go social-only
description: Remove emailAndPassword config from auth.ts. Simplify login page to only show social buttons. Redirect /register to /login. Remove Divider component. Update homepage link to point to /login instead of /register.

title: Build dashboard page
description: Main landing page after login. Layout with widgets/cards for different sections.

title: Implement mentor approval/rejection
description: Mentor can approve or reject with reason. Only mentors/admins. Track who approved and when.

title: Seed vendor data

close_reason: Added team invite links: teamInvites table in schema, invite generation (GET /teams/:teamId/invite), join page (GET /invite/:token), and accept flow (POST /invite/:token). 7-day expiration, single-use tokens, role assignment defaults to student.

description: Show all team orders with status badges. Filter by status (draft/pending/approved/ordered/received). Show totals.

2. Install flyctl: brew install flyctl (or curl -L https://fly.io/install.sh | sh)
3. Login: fly auth login
4. Add payment method (required for custom domains)

description: Email/password registration form with validation. Server-rendered with HTMX form submission.

title: Tailwind CSS CDN warning in production
description: The application uses Tailwind CSS via CDN script tag which shows a console warning about not being suitable for production. Should implement proper Tailwind CSS build process with PostCSS or switch to a production-ready approach.

Comprehensive deployment guide covering:
- Local development setup

- Domain and SSL configuration

title: Build parts list page
description: Display team's parts inventory. Show name, SKU, vendor, quantity, location, reorder status. Sortable/filterable table.
close_reason: Created parts list page with sortable/filterable table, low stock indicators, and vendor display

title: Deployment & DevOps
description: Fly.io deployment, environment configuration, CI/CD setup.

title: Use turso dev for local development
description:
Update local dev workflow to use 'turso dev' instead of plain SQLite file. This ensures same libSQL stack in dev and production.

Changes:
- Update .env.example with turso dev instructions
- Update docs/deployment.md local dev section
- Update src/db/index.ts if needed for http:// URLs
- Add dev script to start turso dev server
close_reason: Updated local dev to use turso dev. Changed .env.example, docs/deployment.md, added dev:db script to package.json. DB config already supports http:// URLs.

title: Fix: XSS vulnerability in error query param display
description: In auth.tsx:30-31 and teams.tsx:47, error query parameters are decoded and displayed without sanitization. While JSX escapes by default, using decodeURIComponent on user-controlled input for display could be risky. Review and ensure consistent sanitization.

title: Build BOM list page by subsystem
description: Display BOM items grouped by subsystem (Drivetrain, Intake, Lift, Scoring, Electronics, etc.). Collapsible sections.
close_reason: Created BOM list page with collapsible subsystem sections (Alpine.js). Shows summary cards (items, needed, on-hand, shortages). Each subsystem section displays parts table with needed vs on-hand comparison and status badges. Shortages highlighted in red. Part names link to part detail page.

title: Fix: Missing input length validation on text fields
description: Form inputs (team name, order notes, rejection reason, etc.) don't have maxLength constraints. Large inputs could cause DoS or database issues. Add maxLength attributes to forms and server-side validation.

title: Add low stock alerts widget
description: Dashboard card showing parts below reorder point with links to parts and quick reorder.

title: Add Google OAuth provider
description: Configure Better-Auth with Google OAuth. Add GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET env vars. Update login/register pages with Google sign-in button.
close_reason: Google OAuth provider configured in auth.ts with socialProviders. Added Google button to SocialAuthButtons component on login/register pages.

title: Implement submit for approval
description: Student submits draft order. Changes status to pending. Notifies mentors (future: email/Discord).
close_reason: Submit for Approval button already implemented in order detail page. Changes status from draft to pending with submittedAt timestamp. Notification system (email/Discord) is a separate future enhancement.

title: Build part detail page
description: Show part details with edit option. Include order history for this part.
close_reason: Created part detail page showing: stats row (in stock with low stock warning, needed from BOM, reorder point, unit price), details grid (description, location, vendor link, last updated), BOM usage by subsystem, and order history table with dates, vendors, quantities, prices, and status badges. Edit button for mentors/admins.

title: Add create order from BOM shortages
description: Button to create draft order pre-populated with BOM shortage items. Group by vendor.

title: Add user profile page
description: Create a user profile page where users can view their account info, see which OAuth providers are linked, and edit basic profile settings like display name.

title: Fix: Invite token uses UUID which may be predictable
description: In teams.tsx:549, invite tokens use crypto.randomUUID(). While UUIDs are unique, UUIDv4 has only ~122 bits of randomness. Consider using crypto.getRandomValues() with base64url encoding for stronger unpredictability (256+ bits).

title: Build order detail page
description: Show order with line items, totals, status timeline, action buttons based on status/role.
close_reason: Enhanced order detail page with status timeline showing progression through draft/pending/approved/ordered/received. Added action buttons based on status/role: Approve/Reject (admin, pending), Mark as Ordered (mentor+, approved), Mark as Received (mentor+, ordered), Delete (admin, draft). Rejection modal with reason input. Status dates displayed in timeline.

title: GitHub OAuth button not working on login/register pages
description:
The 'Continue with GitHub' button on /login and /register pages does nothing when clicked.

INVESTIGATION NOTES:
- Server-side redirect works correctly (302 to github.com/login/oauth/authorize)
- GitHub OAuth credentials ARE configured in .env
- SocialAuthButtons component correctly links to /auth/github
- Better-Auth is properly configured with GitHub provider

LIKELY ROOT CAUSE:
GitHub OAuth App callback URL mismatch. The app needs 'http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/github' registered as an authorized callback URL in GitHub Developer Settings.

ALSO CHECK:
- Browser dev tools network tab when clicking the button
- Whether the redirect actually happens
- GitHub OAuth app settings at github.com/settings/developers
close_reason: GitHub and Google OAuth now working

comments.author: caryden
comments.text: Reopening - fix not verified, issue persists

title: Parallel Bead Worker System
description:
Experiment with async subagents for parallel bead execution. Define orchestration patterns, document in AGENTS.md, and test with real bead work.

## Goals
- Enable main agent to dispatch multiple bead-workers in parallel
- Each worker autonomously completes a single bead
- Workers update bd status as they work
- Discovered work filed back to bd
- Main thread wakes only when needed (completion, blockers, cross-bead issues)

## Subagent Types
1. bead-worker: Completes single bead tasks (sonnet)
2. bead-reviewer: Reviews completed work (sonnet, read-only)
3. bead-coordinator: Monitors progress (haiku, lightweight)

## Rules
- Only dispatch beads with no shared file dependencies
- Check bd dep tree to avoid blocked beads
- Max 3-4 concurrent workers
- Keep delegation flat (main -> workers only)
close_reason: Parallel bead worker experiment successful. Documented pattern in AGENTS.md, updated docs/parallel-bead-workers-prompt.md with lessons learned. Key findings: (1) no custom agent files needed - prompt controls behavior, (2) file independence is critical, (3) workers should be explicit about bd close calls.

title: Document parallel bead orchestration in AGENTS.md
description:
Add a Parallel Bead Execution section to AGENTS.md documenting:
- Quick start examples for parallel dispatch
- Available subagent types and their purposes
- Orchestration pattern (start, dispatch, monitor, review, sync)
- Rules for parallel dispatch (file independence, dep checking, max workers)
- Session ending checklist
close_reason: Added Parallel Bead Execution section to AGENTS.md with quick start examples, subagent patterns table, bead-worker prompt template, orchestration workflow, dispatch rules, and session ending checklist

title: Test parallel bead workers on 2-3 independent beads
description:
After documentation is complete, test the pattern by:
1. Running bd ready to find independent beads
2. Dispatching 2-3 bead-workers in parallel using Task tool with run_in_background
3. Monitoring progress and handling wake-ups
4. Reviewing results
5. Documenting learnings
close_reason: Successfully tested parallel bead workers on 3 independent beads (buildseason-4lw, buildseason-6dn, buildseason-cyf). All completed without file conflicts. One worker didn't auto-close its bead but completed the work.

title: Order Management
description: Full order lifecycle: draft → submit → approve/reject → ordered → received. Includes approval workflows and inventory auto-updates.

title: Audit: Review secrets handling in .env files
description: Ensure GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, and BETTER_AUTH_SECRET are not committed to git. Verify .gitignore includes .env files. Consider adding git-secrets or similar pre-commit hook.

title: Create test utilities and fixtures
description: Create test helpers: mock database, test user factory, request helpers for Hono routes.
close_reason:
Created comprehensive test utilities and fixtures for BuildSeason testing infrastructure. Implemented:
- src/__tests__/fixtures/db.ts: In-memory SQLite test database setup with full schema
- src/__tests__/fixtures/factories.ts: Factory functions for all entities (users, teams, parts, vendors, orders, etc.)
- src/__tests__/fixtures/request.ts: Hono app request helpers for testing routes
- src/__tests__/fixtures/index.ts: Centralized exports for easy imports

All files pass typecheck and lint. Ready for use in unit and integration tests.

Create a cohesive FTC-inspired design system with:
- Color palette using FTC orange/gray/white with CSS variables

- Component patterns for cards, buttons, forms
- FIRST Robotics inspired visual language
- Apply to existing pages for consistency

Reference: FIRST orange #f57e25, tech/engineering aesthetic

description: Team parts catalog with quantities, reorder points, vendor associations, storage locations, and pricing.

title: Fix: SQL-like injection in parts search via LIKE pattern
description: In parts.tsx:50-56, the search query is interpolated directly into a LIKE pattern without escaping SQL wildcards (%, _). A user searching for '%' or '_' could manipulate query results. Escape special characters before using in LIKE clause.

close_reason: Created requireAuth, teamMiddleware, requireRole, requireMentor, requireAdmin middleware.

title: Add unit tests for vendor list page
Add unit tests for team invite link feature
Security review: auth and order flows
description:
Comprehensive security audit. DO NOT FIX issues directly - create new beads for each finding with appropriate priority and deps.

Audit checklist:
- OAuth flow (state parameter, CSRF)
- Session handling and cookie security
- Role-based access control enforcement
- Input validation on all forms
- SQL injection prevention (parameterized queries)
- XSS prevention in JSX templates
- HTMX endpoint authorization
- Rate limiting considerations

For each finding, create a bead like:
  bd create "Fix: [issue]" -t bug -p [priority]
  bd dep add [new-bead] [this-review-bead] -t discovered-from

Close this bead with a summary of findings created.
close_reason:
## Files Reviewed
- src/lib/auth.ts
- src/middleware/auth.ts
- src/routes/auth.tsx
- src/routes/teams.tsx
- src/routes/orders.tsx
- src/routes/parts.tsx
- src/routes/vendors.tsx
- src/components/SocialAuth.tsx
- src/db/schema.ts

## Checklist Results

### OAuth Flow (state parameter, CSRF)
- Reviewed: src/lib/auth.ts, src/components/SocialAuth.tsx
- Result: PASS - Better-Auth handles OAuth state parameter automatically

### Session Handling & Cookie Security
- Reviewed: src/lib/auth.ts
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - Cookie security flags not explicitly configured
- Created: buildseason-z2j (P1)

### RBAC Enforcement
- Reviewed: src/middleware/auth.ts, all route files
- Result: PASS - All protected routes use requireAuth/teamMiddleware, role checks present

### Input Validation (forms, query params)
- Reviewed: src/routes/teams.tsx, orders.tsx, parts.tsx
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - No maxLength validation on text fields
- Created: buildseason-8rx (P3)

### SQL Injection (parameterized queries)
- Reviewed: All route files, src/db/schema.ts
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - LIKE pattern wildcards not escaped in parts search
- Created: buildseason-ftg (P1)

### XSS Prevention in Templates
- Reviewed: src/routes/auth.tsx, teams.tsx
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - decodeURIComponent on error query params
- Created: buildseason-834 (P1)

### HTMX Endpoint Authorization
- Reviewed: All HTMX POST/DELETE endpoints
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - No CSRF token verification on HTMX requests
- Created: buildseason-0ly (P2)

### Rate Limiting
- Reviewed: All auth-related endpoints
- Result: 1 ISSUE FOUND - No rate limiting on invite acceptance
- Created: buildseason-zoj (P2)

### Additional Findings
- Invite token entropy: buildseason-abw (P2) - UUID has 122 bits, could use stronger
- Vendor detail exposure: buildseason-0ja (P3) - Non-global vendors accessible by ID
- Secrets handling: buildseason-ca5 (P2) - Audit .env handling needed

## Summary
- Total checks: 8
- Passed: 3
- Issues found: 9 beads created
- P1: 3, P2: 4, P3: 2

## Created Beads
- buildseason-ftg: Fix: SQL-like injection in parts search (P1)
- buildseason-834: Fix: XSS vulnerability in error query param display (P1)
- buildseason-z2j: Fix: Missing session cookie security flags (P1)
- buildseason-0ly: Fix: Missing CSRF protection on HTMX endpoints (P2)
- buildseason-abw: Fix: Invite token uses UUID (P2)
- buildseason-zoj: Fix: No rate limiting on auth endpoints (P2)
- buildseason-ca5: Audit: Review secrets handling (P2)
- buildseason-0ja: Fix: Vendor detail exposes non-global vendors (P3)
- buildseason-8rx: Fix: Missing input length validation (P3)

title: Build login page
description: Email/password login form with error handling. Redirect to dashboard on success.
close_reason: Created login page with HTMX form submission and loading indicator

title: Authentication & Teams
description: User registration, login, team creation, team membership with roles (admin, mentor, student), and invite links.

title: Production Deployment
description: Set up Turso database, Fly.io hosting, domain, SSL, and production secrets for buildseason.org

title: Create production OAuth apps
description:
Create separate OAuth apps for production:

GitHub:
1. https://github.com/settings/developers > New OAuth App
2. Name: buildseason-prod
3. Homepage: https://buildseason.org
4. Callback: https://buildseason.org/api/auth/callback/github

Google:
1. https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials
2. Create new OAuth 2.0 Client ID
3. Authorized origins: https://buildseason.org
4. Redirect URI: https://buildseason.org/api/auth/callback/google

Save the client IDs and secrets securely.

title: Show needed vs on-hand comparison
description: Display quantity needed vs quantity on hand. Highlight shortages. Calculate what needs ordering.

title: Add recent activity feed
description: Show recent team activity: orders created/approved, parts added, inventory changes.

title: Code review: patterns and quality
description:
Comprehensive code quality audit. DO NOT FIX issues directly - create new beads for each finding with appropriate priority.

Audit checklist:
- Consistency of patterns across routes
- Dead code and unused imports
- Error handling completeness
- Type safety (any types, missing types)
- Component reusability opportunities
- Database query efficiency (N+1 queries)
- Code duplication to refactor
- Documentation gaps
- Test coverage assessment

For each finding, create a bead like:
  bd create "Refactor: [issue]" -t task -p [priority]
  bd dep add [new-bead] [this-review-bead] -t discovered-from

Close this bead with a summary of findings created.

title: Tailwind CSS CDN should not be used in production
description: Console warning: cdn.tailwindcss.com should not be used in production. Need to install Tailwind CSS properly via PostCSS plugin or Tailwind CLI as part of the build process.

title: Fix: Missing session cookie security flags configuration
description: In lib/auth.ts, Better-Auth session config doesn't explicitly set cookie security options. Should configure: httpOnly: true, secure: true (prod), sameSite: 'lax' or 'strict'. Review Better-Auth docs for proper cookie configuration.

title: Complete initial deployment
description:
Final deployment checklist:
1. Set Fly.io secrets from production credentials
2. Deploy to Fly.io: fly deploy
3. Configure custom domain in Fly.io
4. Update Namecheap DNS to point to Fly.io
5. Verify SSL certificate
6. Test OAuth flows on production
7. Verify database connectivity

title: Fix: No rate limiting on authentication endpoints
description: OAuth endpoints and invite acceptance have no rate limiting. While OAuth providers have their own limits, the /invite/:token endpoint could be brute-forced. Add rate limiting middleware (e.g., hono/rate-limiter) to sensitive endpoints.

title: Add lint-staged configuration
description: Configure lint-staged to run ESLint and Prettier on staged files during pre-commit.
close_reason: Configured lint-staged in package.json for ESLint + Prettier on staged files
